result.execSummary:
On one or more charges, the deferred prosecution or sentencing agreement(s) on this case were fulfilled, and the charge(s) were dismissed.

The defendant Isaiah M. Hayes was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of THC, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(e).
  • Possess Drug Paraphernalia, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.573(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Defendant to report to the DOC in Ashland TODAY!!
Ct 1 - DEJ (copy attached)

miscConds.notes:
While on supervision the Defendant is to pay their financial obligations through the Clerk of Courts Office, which may include payments on restitution, fines, costs, surcharges that are court ordered.
The payments are to be paid directly to the Clerk of Court Office at:
Clerk of Circuit Court Ashland County
201 West Main Street, Room 307
Ashland,WI  54806
Def placed on a pymt plan of $25/mo beginning 12/12/14.
Upon successful completion of the terms/conditions of supervision followed with a letter confirming successful completion from DOC, this record would be expunged!

Defendant shall not possess or consume alcoholic beverages, illegal drugs, or any mind altering substances(MAS).  MAS means alcoholic beverages, controlled substances other than those prescribed by treating physician to the Defendant, inhalants, synthetic marijuana or a similar substance, and/or over-the-counter medications used contrary to label instructions.  THE DEFENDANT IS TO MAINTAIN ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY.
The Defendant shall not enter any bars, taverns, liquor stores,(any place where the primary purpose is the sale of alcohol), any place where mind altering substances are present, consumed or sold..
  The Defendant is to take all his/her prescribed medications as prescribed by treating physician and all prescribed medication(s) taken only as prescribed!
  The Defendant is subject to random UA testing.
The money seized is to be turned over to the Clk of Courts Office & to be applied to fines & fees.
Undergo alcohol/drug assessment and complete recommended treatment-responsible for finding the funding for any treatment/counseling recommended.
